PredicateCore.js

  1. /**
  2.  * Rules
  3.  * @module core
  4.  * @namespace core
  5.  * @since 1.0.0
  6.  * @note rules are 100% tested from PredicateCore.test.js
  7.  */
  9. const {
  10.   merge,
  11.   find,
  12.   curry,
  13.   prop,
  14.   tap,
  15.   pipe,
  16.   filter,
  17.   map,
  18.   over,
  19.   lens,
  20.   lensPath,
  21.   takeLast,
  22.   clone,
  23.   keys,
  24.   startsWith,
  25.   set,
  26.   differenceWith,
  27.   partition,
  28.   lensProp,
  29.   insert,
  30. } = require('ramda');
  32. const option = require('option');
  34. const { EventEmitter } = require('events');
  36. function head(list) {
  37.   return option.fromNullable(list[0]).value();
  38. }
  40. module.exports = function({ dataclasses, invariants, errors, rules }) {
  41.   const {
  42.     CompoundPredicate,
  43.     ComparisonPredicate,
  44.     Predicate,
  45.     Target,
  46.     LogicalType,
  47.   } = dataclasses;
  48.   /**
  49.    * Get a type by its type_id
  50.    * @param  {array} types
  51.    * @param  {string} type_id   type id name
  52.    * @return {?Type}  a Type
  53.    * @private
  54.    * @since 1.0.0
  55.    */
  56.   const _getTypeById = (types, type_id) =>
  57.     option.fromNullable(find(type => type.type_id == type_id, types));
  59.   /**
  60.    * Get a target by its target_id
  61.    * @param  {array} targets
  62.    * @param  {string} target_id target id name
  63.    * @return {?dataclasses.Target}
  64.    * @private
  65.    * @since 1.0.0
  66.    */
  67.   const _getTargetById = (targets, target_id) =>
  68.     option.fromNullable(find(target => target.target_id == target_id, targets));
  70.   /**
  71.    * Get a logical type by its logicalType_id
  72.    * @param  {array} logicalTypes
  73.    * @param  {string} logicalType_id logicalType id name
  74.    * @return {?dataclasses.Target}
  75.    * @private
  76.    * @since 1.0.0
  77.    */
  78.   const _getLogicalTypeById = (logicalTypes, logicalType_id) =>
  79.     option.fromNullable(
  80.       find(
  81.         logicalType => logicalType.logicalType_id == logicalType_id,
  82.         logicalTypes
  83.       )
  84.     );
  86.   /**
  87.    * _getOperatorsByIds
  88.    * @param  {Object} columns
  89.    * @param  {string[]} operator_ids
  90.    * @return {Array<dataclasses.operator>}
  91.    * @private
  92.    * @since 1.0.0
  93.    */
  94.   const _getOperatorsByIds = curry((operators, operator_ids) =>
  95.     pipe(filter(({ operator_id }) => operator_ids.includes(operator_id)))(
  96.       operators
  97.     )
  98.   );
  100.   const _set$operatorsToType = curry((columns, type) => {
  101.     type.$operators = _getOperatorsByIds(columns.operators, type.operator_ids);
  102.     return type;
  103.   });
  105.   const _set$typeToTarget = curry((columns, target) => {
  106.     const typeOption = _getTypeById(columns.types, target.type_id);
  107.     return invariants
  108.       .TargetMustReferToADefinedType(typeOption, target)
  109.       .then(type => {
  110.         target.$type = type;
  111.         return target;
  112.       });
  113.   });
  115.   /**
  116.    * Tap for Promise
  117.    * @param  {Function} f
  118.    * @return {Function}
  119.    * @private
  120.    */
  121.   const _tapPromise = f => {
  122.     return function(promise) {
  123.       return promise.then(result => {
  124.         f();
  125.         return result;
  126.       });
  127.     };
  128.   };
  130.   /**
  131.    * Run `fAfter()` (without any arguments) after `fBefore`, it will yield the promise yield from fBefore
  132.    * @param  {Function} fBefore
  133.    * @param  {Function} fAfter
  134.    * @return {Promise} promise from fBefore
  135.    * @private
  136.    */
  137.   const _afterPromise = (fBefore, fAfter) => pipe(fBefore, _tapPromise(fAfter));
  139.   // columns => Promise[columns]
  140.   const initializeColumns = columns => {
  141.     // at first I used lenses, but the code was way harder to read so it's better that way :)
  143.     // wrap operators
  144.     columns.operators = map(dataclasses.Operator, columns.operators);
  146.     // wrap logicalTypes
  147.     columns.logicalTypes = map(dataclasses.LogicalType, columns.logicalTypes);
  149.     // wrap types and set `$operators` attribute on each type
  150.     const wrapType = pipe(dataclasses.Type, _set$operatorsToType(columns));
  151.     columns.types = map(wrapType, columns.types);
  153.     // wrap targets and set `$type` attribut on each target
  154.     const wrapTarget = pipe(dataclasses.Target, _set$typeToTarget(columns));
  155.     return Promise.all(map(wrapTarget, columns.targets)).then(targets => {
  156.       columns.targets = targets;
  157.       return columns;
  158.     });
  159.   };
  161.   /**
  162.    * Create a new PredicateCore
  163.    * @param       {?dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} [data=PredicateCore.defaults.options.getDefaultData]
  164.    * @param       {Object} [columns=PredicateCore.defaults.columns]
  165.    * @param       {Object} [options=PredicateCore.defaults.options]
  166.    * @return {Promise<core.PredicateCoreAPI>}
  167.    * @memberof core
  168.    */
  169.   function PredicateCore({ data, columns, options } = {}) {
  170.     return initializeColumns(columns || PredicateCore.defaults.columns).then(
  171.       _columns => {
  172.         let _root;
  173.         let _api;
  174.         const _events = new EventEmitter();
  175.         const _options = merge(PredicateCore.defaults.options, options);
  177.         /**
  178.          * Loop through the predicate tree and update flags (e.g. $canBeRemoved)
  179.          * @private
  180.          */
  181.         function _apply$flags() {
  182.           const canRemoveAnyPredicate = !rules.predicateToRemoveIsTheLastComparisonPredicate(
  183.             _root,
  184.             CompoundPredicate,
  185.             ComparisonPredicate
  186.           );
  188.           CompoundPredicate.forEach(_root, function(predicate) {
  189.             predicate.$canBeRemoved =
  190.               canRemoveAnyPredicate &&
  191.               !rules.predicateToRemoveIsRootPredicate(_root, predicate);
  192.           });
  193.         }
  195.         function _emitChangedEvent() {
  196.           _events.emit('changed', _api);
  197.         }
  199.         const _afterWrite = pipe(_apply$flags, _emitChangedEvent);
  201.         /**
  202.          * Set PredicateCore data
  203.          * @param {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} root CompoundPredicate
  204.          * @return {Promise<undefined, errors.RootPredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate>} resolved promise yield nothing, rejected promise yield RootPredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate error
  205.          * @since 1.0.0
  206.          * @memberof core.api
  207.          */
  208.         function setData(root) {
  209.           return invariants
  210.             .RootPredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate(root, CompoundPredicate)
  211.             .then(() => {
  212.               _root = root;
  213.             });
  214.         }
  216.         /**
  217.          * Add a ComparisonPredicate or CompoundPredicate
  218.          * @param  {Object} option
  219.          * @param  {string} options.type what type of Predicate to add
  220.          * @param  {string} [options.how=after] should we insert it before, after or instead of? (currently only after is supported)
  221.          * @param  {dataclasses.Predicate} options.where current element
  222.          * @return {Promise<dataclasses.Predicate>} inserted predicate
  223.          * @since 1.0.0
  224.          * @memberof core.api
  225.          */
  226.         function add({ where, how = 'after', type }) {
  227.           // currently only after is supported
  228.           return (
  229.             Promise.resolve()
  230.               .then(() => invariants.AddOnlySupportsAfter(how))
  231.               .then(() =>
  232.                 invariants.PredicateTypeMustBeValid(type, Predicate.Types)
  233.               )
  234.               // generate the Predicates
  235.               .then(() => _options[`getDefault${type}`](_columns, _options))
  236.               // then add it
  237.               .then(predicate => {
  238.                 const isComparisonPredicate = ComparisonPredicate.is(where);
  240.                 if (isComparisonPredicate || CompoundPredicate.is(where)) {
  241.                   if (isComparisonPredicate) {
  242.                     // it's a comparisonpredicate
  243.                     // first find predicates array that contains the element
  244.                     const path = _find(where);
  245.                     // we are starting from a ComparisonPredicate that always live inside a CompoundPredicate.predicates array
  246.                     const [compoundpredicate, [_, index]] = takeLast(2, path);
  247.                     compoundpredicate.predicates = insert(
  248.                       index + 1,
  249.                       predicate,
  250.                       compoundpredicate.predicates
  251.                     );
  252.                   } else {
  253.                     // it's a compoundpredicate
  254.                     // we want to add a CompoundPredicate after a compound predicate
  255.                     // so we need to add it as its first .predicates entry
  256.                     where.predicates.unshift(predicate);
  257.                   }
  259.                   return predicate;
  260.                 }
  262.                 return Promise.reject(
  263.                   new errors.CannotAddSomethingElseThanACompoundPredicateOrAComparisonPredicate()
  264.                 );
  265.               })
  266.           );
  267.         }
  269.         /**
  270.          * Remove a ComparisonPredicate or CompoundPredicate
  271.          * @param  {(dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate|dataclasses.CompoundPredicate)} predicate
  272.          * @return {Promise<dataclasses.Predicate>} yield the removed predicate, will reject the promise if remove was called with the root CompoundPredicate or the last ComparisonPredicate of the root CompoundPredicate
  273.          * @since 1.0.0
  274.          * @memberof core.api
  275.          */
  276.         function remove(predicate) {
  277.           return Promise.resolve()
  278.             .then(() =>
  279.               invariants.RemovePredicateMustDifferFromRootPredicate(
  280.                 _root,
  281.                 predicate
  282.               )
  283.             )
  284.             .then(() =>
  285.               invariants.RemovePredicateCannotBeTheLastComparisonPredicate(
  286.                 _root,
  287.                 predicate,
  288.                 CompoundPredicate,
  289.                 ComparisonPredicate
  290.               )
  291.             )
  292.             .then(() => {
  293.               if (
  294.                 CompoundPredicate.is(predicate) ||
  295.                 ComparisonPredicate.is(predicate)
  296.               ) {
  297.                 const path = _find(predicate);
  298.                 // we are starting from a ComparisonPredicate that always live
  299.                 // inside a CompoundPredicate.predicates array
  300.                 const [parentCompoundpredicate, [_, index]] = takeLast(2, path);
  301.                 parentCompoundpredicate.predicates.splice(index, 1);
  303.                 if (parentCompoundpredicate.predicates.length === 0) {
  304.                   // if there are not any more predicates
  305.                   // inside the parentCompoundpredicate, we should also remove it
  306.                   return remove(parentCompoundpredicate);
  307.                 }
  309.                 return predicate;
  310.               }
  312.               return Promise.reject(
  313.                 new errors.CannotRemoveSomethingElseThanACompoundPredicateOrAComparisonPredicate()
  314.               );
  315.             });
  316.         }
  318.         /**
  319.          * Change a CompoundPredicate logical
  320.          * @param {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} predicate
  321.          * @param {string} newLogicalType_id
  322.          * @return {Promise<undefined, errors.PredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate>} yield nothing if everything went right, otherwise yield a reject promise with the PredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate error
  323.          * @since 1.0.0
  324.          * @memberof core.api
  325.          */
  326.         function setPredicateLogicalType_id(predicate, newLogicalType_id) {
  327.           return invariants
  328.             .PredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate(predicate, CompoundPredicate)
  329.             .then(() => {
  330.               // first change the logical type
  331.               return _getLogicalTypeById(
  332.                 _columns.logicalTypes,
  333.                 newLogicalType_id
  334.               );
  335.             })
  336.             .then(logicalTypeOption =>
  337.               invariants.LogicalType_idMustReferToADefinedLogicalType(
  338.                 logicalTypeOption
  339.               )
  340.             )
  341.             .then(logicalTypeOption => {
  342.               predicate.logic = logicalTypeOption.value(); // safe
  343.             });
  344.         }
  346.         /**
  347.          * Change a predicate's target
  348.          * @param {dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate} predicate
  349.          * @param {string} newTarget_id
  350.          * @return {Promise} yield nothing if everything went right, otherwise yield a reject promise with the PredicateMustBeAComparisonPredicate error
  351.          * @since 1.0.0
  352.          * @memberof core.api
  353.          */
  354.         function setPredicateTarget_id(predicate, newTarget_id) {
  355.           return invariants
  356.             .PredicateMustBeAComparisonPredicate(predicate, ComparisonPredicate)
  357.             .then(() => {
  358.               // first change the target
  359.               return _getTargetById(_columns.targets, newTarget_id);
  360.             })
  361.             .then(targetOption =>
  362.               invariants.Target_idMustReferToADefinedTarget(targetOption)
  363.             )
  364.             .then(targetOption => {
  365.               predicate.target = targetOption.value(); // safe
  367.               // then change the operator to the first operator for this target
  368.               return setPredicateOperator_id(
  369.                 predicate,
  370.                 head(predicate.target.$type.$operators).operator_id
  371.               );
  372.             });
  373.         }
  375.         /**
  376.          * Change a predicate's operator
  377.          * @param {dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate} predicate
  378.          * @param {string} newTarget_id
  379.          * @return {Promise<undefined, errors.PredicateMustBeAComparisonPredicate>} yield nothing if everything went right, otherwise yield a reject promise with the PredicateMustBeAComparisonPredicate error
  380.          * @since 1.0.0
  381.          * @memberof core.api
  382.          */
  383.         function setPredicateOperator_id(predicate, newOperator_id) {
  384.           return (
  385.             Promise.resolve()
  386.               // find operator
  387.               .then(() =>
  388.                 option.fromNullable(
  389.                   predicate.target.$type.$operators.find(
  390.                     operator => operator.operator_id === newOperator_id
  391.                   )
  392.                 )
  393.               )
  395.               .then(operatorOption =>
  396.                 invariants.Operator_idMustReferToADefinedOperator(
  397.                   operatorOption
  398.                 )
  399.               )
  400.               // change the operator
  401.               .then(operatorOption => {
  402.                 predicate.operator = operatorOption.value(); // safe
  404.                 // then reset arguments to array
  405.                 predicate.arguments = [];
  406.               })
  407.           );
  408.         }
  410.         /**
  411.          * Compute the JSON pointer path the element
  412.          * @param  {Object} element (http://jsonpatch.com/)
  413.          * @return {?Array} null if not found
  414.          * @readonly
  415.          * @since 1.0.0
  416.          */
  417.         function _find(element) {
  418.           return CompoundPredicate.reduce(
  419.             _root,
  420.             (acc, predicate, parents) => {
  421.               return element === predicate ? parents : acc;
  422.             },
  423.             null
  424.           );
  425.         }
  427.         /**
  428.          * Yield a serializable object without internal flags ($xxx properties)
  429.          * @example console.log(JSON.stringify(ctrl, null, 2)); // will call ctrl.toJSON() underneath
  430.          * @return {Object} a serializable object
  431.          * @since 1.0.0
  432.          * @memberof core.api
  433.          */
  434.         function toJSON() {
  435.           const root = clone(_root);
  437.           const toString = Object.prototype.toString;
  438.           const isObject = mixed => toString.call(mixed) === '[object Object]';
  440.           // we just need to go one-level deep
  441.           function remove$flagsFromObj(obj, level = 1) {
  442.             /* istanbul ignore if */
  443.             if (level < 0) {
  444.               return;
  445.             }
  447.             keys(obj).forEach(key => {
  448.               if (key === 'predicates') {
  449.                 return;
  450.               }
  452.               if (startsWith('$', key)) {
  453.                 delete obj[key];
  454.               }
  456.               if (isObject(obj[key])) {
  457.                 remove$flagsFromObj(obj[key], level - 1);
  458.               }
  459.             });
  460.           }
  462.           CompoundPredicate.forEach(root, remove$flagsFromObj);
  464.           return root;
  465.         }
  467.         /**
  468.          * Adds the `listener` function to the end of the listeners array for the event named `eventName`.
  469.          * No checks are made to see if the `listener` has already been added. Multiple calls passing the same combination of eventName and listener will result in the listener being added, and called, multiple times.
  470.          * @param  {string} eventName available event names are : (`changed`, api)
  471.          * @param  {function} listener
  472.          * @since 1.0.0
  473.          * @memberof core.api
  474.          */
  475.         function on(eventName, listener) {
  476.           _events.on(eventName, listener);
  477.         }
  479.         /**
  480.          * Adds a *one-time* `listener` function for the event named `eventName`. The next time `eventName` is triggered, this `listener` is removed and then invoked.
  481.          * @param  {string} eventName see {@link core.api.on} for available event names
  482.          * @param  {function} listener
  483.          * @see core.api.on
  484.          * @since 1.0.0
  485.          * @memberof core.api
  486.          */
  487.         function once(eventName, listener) {
  488.           _events.once(eventName, listener);
  489.         }
  491.         /**
  492.          * Remove listener(s)
  493.          * If off() will remove every listeners
  494.          * If off(eventName) will only remove listeners to this specific eventName
  495.          * If off(eventName, listener) will remove the `listener` to the `eventName`
  496.          * @param  {?string} eventName see {@link core.api.on} for available event names
  497.          * @param  {?function} listener
  498.          * @since 1.0.0
  499.          * @memberof core.api
  500.          */
  501.         function off(eventName, listener) {
  502.           if (!eventName) {
  503.             // because removeAllListeners treat "undefined" as an event name :facepalm:
  504.             _events.removeAllListeners();
  505.           } else if (!listener) {
  506.             _events.removeAllListeners(eventName);
  507.           } else {
  508.             _events.removeListener(eventName, listener);
  509.           }
  510.         }
  512.         // get data for initialization
  513.         return (
  514.           (data
  515.             ? Promise.resolve(data)
  516.             : _options.getDefaultData(_columns, _options)
  517.           )
  518.             // setup PredicateCore data
  519.             .then(_afterPromise(setData, _afterWrite))
  520.             // expose public API
  521.             .then(() => {
  522.               /**
  523.                * ui-predicate core public API
  524.                * @typedef {object} PredicateCoreAPI
  525.                * @namespace core.api
  526.                */
  527.               _api = {
  528.                 on: on,
  529.                 once: once,
  530.                 off: off,
  532.                 setData: _afterPromise(setData, _afterWrite),
  533.                 add: _afterPromise(add, _afterWrite),
  534.                 remove: _afterPromise(remove, _afterWrite),
  535.                 setPredicateTarget_id: _afterPromise(
  536.                   setPredicateTarget_id,
  537.                   _afterWrite
  538.                 ),
  539.                 setPredicateOperator_id: _afterPromise(
  540.                   setPredicateOperator_id,
  541.                   _afterWrite
  542.                 ),
  543.                 setPredicateLogicalType_id: _afterPromise(
  544.                   setPredicateLogicalType_id,
  545.                   _afterWrite
  546.                 ),
  548.                 /**
  549.                  * Get root CompoundPredicate
  550.                  * @return {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate}
  551.                  * @memberof core.api
  552.                  */
  553.                 get root() {
  554.                   return _root;
  555.                 },
  557.                 toJSON,
  559.                 // used for testing
  560.                 get columns() {
  561.                   return _columns;
  562.                 },
  564.                 // used for testing
  565.                 get options() {
  566.                   return _options;
  567.                 },
  568.               };
  570.               return _api;
  571.             })
  572.         );
  573.       }
  574.     );
  575.   }
  577.   /**
  578.    * Defaults configuration of PredicateCore
  579.    * @type {Object}
  580.    * @namespace core.defaults
  581.    */
  582.   PredicateCore.defaults = {
  583.     options: {
  584.       /**
  585.        * When data is not set at construction time PredicateCore default behavior will be to use the first target and its first operator with empty argument
  586.        * @param  {Object} dataclasses every necessary data class
  587.        * @param  {Object} columns every necessary data class
  588.        * @param  {Object} options PredicateCore available options
  589.        * @return {Promise<dataclasses.CompoundPredicate>}  root CompoundPredicate
  590.        * @since 1.0.0
  591.        * @memberof core.defaults
  592.        */
  593.       getDefaultData(columns, options) {
  594.         return options
  595.           .getDefaultComparisonPredicate(columns, options)
  596.           .then(comparisonPredicate => {
  597.             return options.getDefaultCompoundPredicate(columns, options, [
  598.               comparisonPredicate,
  599.             ]);
  600.           });
  601.       },
  603.       /**
  604.        * Default compount predicate to use
  605.        *
  606.        * This function is called whenever a new CompoundPredicate is added to the UIPredicate
  607.        * @param  {Array<dataclasses.Predicate>} predicates
  608.        * @param  {Object} columns specified columns
  609.        * @param  {Object} options PredicateCore available options
  610.        * @return {Promise<dataclasses.CompoundPredicate>} a CompoundPredicate
  611.        * @since 1.0.0
  612.        * @memberof core.defaults
  613.        */
  614.       getDefaultCompoundPredicate(columns, options, predicates) {
  615.         return (!Array.isArray(predicates) || predicates.length === 0
  616.           ? options
  617.               .getDefaultComparisonPredicate(columns, options)
  618.               .then(comparisonPredicate => [comparisonPredicate])
  619.           : Promise.resolve(predicates)
  620.         ).then(predicates =>
  621.           options
  622.             .getDefaultLogicalType(predicates, columns, options)
  623.             .then(logicalType => CompoundPredicate(logicalType, predicates))
  624.         );
  625.       },
  627.       /**
  628.        * Default comparison predicate to use
  629.        *
  630.        * This function is called whenever a new ComparisonPredicate is added to the UIPredicate
  631.        * @param  {Object} columns specified columns
  632.        * @param  {Object} [options=PredicateCore.defaults.options] PredicateCore available options
  633.        * @return {Promise<dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate>} a Comparison
  634.        * @since 1.0.0
  635.        * @memberof core.defaults
  636.        */
  637.       getDefaultComparisonPredicate(columns, options) {
  638.         const firstTarget = head(columns.targets);
  639.         return ComparisonPredicate(
  640.           firstTarget,
  641.           head(firstTarget.$type.$operators),
  642.           []
  643.         );
  644.       },
  646.       /**
  647.        * Default logical type to use when a new comparison predicate is created
  648.        *
  649.        * This function is called whenever a new ComparisonPredicate is added to the UIPredicate
  650.        * @param  {Array<dataclasses.Predicate>} predicates specified columns
  651.        * @param  {Object} columns specified columns
  652.        * @param  {Object} [options=PredicateCore.defaults.options] PredicateCore available options
  653.        * @return {Promise<dataclasses.LogicalType>} a logical type
  654.        * @since 1.0.0
  655.        * @memberof core.defaults
  656.        */
  657.       getDefaultLogicalType(predicates, columns, options) {
  658.         return Promise.resolve(head(columns.logicalTypes));
  659.       },
  660.     },
  661.     columns: {
  662.       // besides array list names, everything else follows convention https://github.com/FGRibreau/sql-convention
  663.       operators: [
  664.         {
  665.           operator_id: 'is',
  666.           label: 'is',
  667.         },
  668.         {
  669.           operator_id: 'contains',
  670.           label: 'contains',
  671.         },
  672.         {
  673.           operator_id: 'isLowerThan',
  674.           label: '<',
  675.         },
  676.         {
  677.           operator_id: 'isEqualTo',
  678.           label: '=',
  679.         },
  680.         {
  681.           operator_id: 'isHigherThan',
  682.           label: '>',
  683.         },
  684.         {
  685.           operator_id: 'isBetween',
  686.           label: 'is between',
  687.         },
  688.       ],
  689.       types: [
  690.         {
  691.           type_id: 'int',
  692.           operator_ids: ['isLowerThan', 'isEqualTo', 'isHigherThan'],
  693.         },
  694.         {
  695.           type_id: 'string',
  696.           operator_ids: ['is', 'contains'],
  697.         },
  698.         {
  699.           type_id: 'datetime',
  700.           operator_ids: ['is', 'isBetween'],
  701.         },
  702.       ],
  703.       targets: [
  704.         {
  705.           target_id: 'title',
  706.           label: 'Title',
  707.           type_id: 'string',
  708.         },
  709.         {
  710.           target_id: 'videoCount',
  711.           label: 'Video count',
  712.           type_id: 'int',
  713.         },
  714.         {
  715.           target_id: 'publishedAt',
  716.           label: 'Created at',
  717.           type_id: 'datetime',
  718.         },
  719.       ],
  720.       logicalTypes: [
  721.         {
  722.           logicalType_id: 'any',
  723.           label: 'Any',
  724.         },
  725.         {
  726.           logicalType_id: 'all',
  727.           label: 'All',
  728.         },
  729.         {
  730.           logicalType_id: 'none',
  731.           label: 'None',
  732.         },
  733.       ],
  734.     },
  735.   };
  737.   return PredicateCore;
  738. };
